PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Consistent with the observed homogeneous donor : acceptor network with the smallest rms roughness , the PffBB-14 - based device exhibited the highest J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 and FF of 64.36% , suggesting efficient charge dissociation and transport.

Let's think step by step.

Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph presented as a Markdown table:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| homogeneous donor : acceptor network |
| smallest rms roughness |
| highest J sc |
| FF |

Note that "J sc" is written as it is in the original paragraph, but it is unclear what it stands for. If it is meant to be "Jsc" (which is a common term in solar cell research, standing for "short-circuit current density"), then it should be presented as such.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

After reviewing the paragraph, I believe that all of the identified entities are material properties. Here is the updated Markdown table:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| homogeneous donor : acceptor network |
| smallest rms roughness |
| highest J sc |
| FF |

"Homogeneous donor : acceptor network" refers to the uniformity of the material composition, "smallest rms roughness" refers to the surface roughness of the material, "highest J sc" refers to the short-circuit current density of the material, and "FF" refers to the fill factor of the material, which is a measure of the material's efficiency in converting sunlight into electricity.
